articles.headline: The Irksome Cellphone Industry
articles.snippet: Unfair and anticompetitive practices include text-messaging fees, double billing and international roaming charges.
articles.abstract: Unfair and anticompetitive practices include text-messaging fees, double billing and international roaming charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Never let it be said that Congress never did anything for you.

articles.headline: Strategic Issues, Not Abuses, Are U.S. Focus in Kyrgyzstan
articles.snippet: President Obama praised the country’s leader after he reversed a decision to close an American air base.
articles.abstract: President Obama praised the country’s leader after he reversed a decision to close an American air base.
articles.lead_paragraph: BISHKEK, Kyrgyzstan  “You know what this is for,” Emilbek Kaptagaev recalled being told by the police officers who snatched him off the street. No other words, just blows to the head, then all went black. Mr. Kaptagaev, an opponent of Kyrgyzstan’s president, who is a vital American ally in the war in nearby Afghanistan, was found later in a field with a concussion, broken ribs and a face swollen into a mosaic of bruises.

articles.headline: More Cost Cuts Sought From Drug Industry
articles.snippet: The pharmaceutical industry has remained relatively unscathed so far in Washington’s effort to overhaul the nation’s health care system, but it is too soon for drug makers to declare victory.
articles.abstract: The pharmaceutical industry has remained relatively unscathed so far in Washington’s effort to overhaul the nation’s health care system, but it is too soon for drug makers to declare victory.
articles.lead_paragraph: The pharmaceutical industry has remained relatively unscathed so far in Washington’s effort to overhaul the nation’s health care system. But it is too soon for drug makers to declare victory  especially now that the cost of health care has become a central issue in the debate.

articles.headline: Daring to Dream of a Resurgent AOL
articles.snippet: Tim Armstrong, chief executive of AOL, wants to make the company the biggest creator of premium content on the Web and the largest seller of online display advertising.
articles.abstract: Tim Armstrong, chief executive of AOL, wants to make the company the biggest creator of premium content on the Web and the largest seller of online display advertising.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after Tim Armstrong took over as chief executive of AOL, he asked to see the list of business deals that were being negotiated. He saw 900 of them.

articles.headline: Dow Closes Over 9,000; First Time Since January
articles.snippet: A report showing that sales of existing homes rose 3.6 percent in June and a flurry of positive earnings reports fueled the surge.
articles.abstract: A report showing that sales of existing homes rose 3.6 percent in June and a flurry of positive earnings reports fueled the surge.
articles.lead_paragraph: The numbers are a bit breathtaking: In a little more than four months, the Dow Jones industrial average has leapt more than 2,500 points  nearly 39 percent  to close above 9,000 for the first time since January.
